data.benefits: Scheme provides maximum guarantee on cover for loans up to Rs. 1000 Lakh, without third-party guarantee and collateral.
data.eligibility: All Startups registered with DPIIT are eligible under this scheme.
data.conditions:
1. Startups that have reached stage of stable revenue stream, as assessed from audited monthly statements over a 12-month period, amenable to debt financing. 
  2. Startup not in default to any lending/investing institution and not classified as Non-Performing Asset as per RBI guidelines.
data.beneficiaries: All Startups registered with DPIIT are eligible under this scheme.
data.prerequisites:
1. Startups that have reached stage of stable revenue stream, as assessed from audited monthly statements over a 12-month period, amenable to debt financing. 
  2. Startup not in default to any lending/investing institution and not classified as Non-Performing Asset as per RBI guidelines.
data.nodal_agency: National Credit Guarantee Trustee Company Ltd (NCGTC)
data.context: To support startups that are hit hard by the pandemic and are now going to be impacted further by the rising interest rate scenario when liquidity is unlikely to be easily available to new entrepreneurs.
data.objective: To provide credit guarantees to facilitate easier access to collateral-free loans for eligible startups, thereby promoting entrepreneurship, innovation, and the growth of the startup ecosystem in India.
data.description:
The CGSS offers credit guarantees to loans provided by Member Institutions (MIs) to eligible startup borrowers up to Rs. 1000 Lakhs.  

  1. To the extent of 80% of the amount in default if the original loan sanction amount is upto Rs.300 lakhs. 
  2. To the extent of 75% of the amount in default if the original loan sanction amount is above Rs. 300 lakhs and upto Rs. 500 lakhs. 
  3. To the extent of 65% of the amount in default if the original loan sanction amount is above Rs. 500 lakhs.
data.how_to_apply: Eligible startups may approach Member institutions for funding requirements, who would evaluate the same in accordance with general lending protocols and schemes and other guidelines.
data.funding_mechanism: The Applicant will get a credit guarantee after approval of the application and in case of default by the applicant, it will be provided directly to the Bank subject to fulfilment of conditions.
data.additional_info: Member Institutions (MIs) means a financial intermediary (Banks, FIs, NBFCs, AIFs) engaged in lending/investing and conforming to the eligibility criteria duly approved under the scheme and as modified by the Trust, from time to time, and who have entered into an agreement with/submitted Undertaking to the Trust for availing the guarantee.
data.checklist_info_a:
DPIIT Certificate 
-Other basic KYC documents 
-ITR, P&L, B/S of last 3 FY and current FY (Till date) 
-Business incorporation letter / Company registration certificate 
-CIBIL Report 
-Business Project Report 
-Business Plan (Business model, promoter profile, and projected financials)
data.checklist_info_d:
Address:

data.beneficiary: Manufacturing and Service Industry  - Partnership, Private Limited company, Limited Liability Partnership (LLP)  - All Locations  - All MSMEs
data.lifecycle: Required Credit Support for Scale  - Up
